text: Hi there, I am re designing the blog archive page for a HubSpot website. I want to add a search bar which allows users to search for specific blog by text, is this possible? I would also like to make dynamic loading when you scroll down the page rather than pages?

You can use the search client here in JS to dynamically load the results <https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vTuu12oFF4bQY1zVD2-WKFuM2dEDN81-fZRV1tGaCL5Z_OcjC-B6O3mHXR6chaq25BU1D2FuvKIjc49/pub>
This is awesome! Thanks <@U6GNQ7JBU>
Adding this on my own super secret cheat codes :sweat_smile:
<@U6GNQ7JBU> any chance you can give me some examples of how to use it? The example on that link isn't the best
Sure first you should get familiar with the API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>
When you do something like `window.hubdbClient.search({"term": "test"}, callback)`
You can pass in any query parameters in a dict and it will hit the search endpoint `/_hcms/search`
`callback` is a function reference you pass which will be called with an array of the results
It’s easier to see with the HubDB example above it

Thing is <@U6GNQ7JBU> I add window.hubdbClient.search({"term": "test"}, callback) into my function to query a search and it kills the rest of my Javascript haha. So for example, nothing goes past it. I will check my consolefor any errors
Yea let me know the error you are seeing
What is supposed to happen when I call the function? Is it meant to redirect me or anything?
<@U6GNQ7JBU> <https://hastebin.com/lomazetahu.coffeescript>
<@U6GNQ7JBU> it also seems to return search function does not exist yet I have both of the links within my head tags so it should work in reality
Do you have an example template?

Do not believe so although here is the code I am using:

<https://hastebin.com/nefepugixi.js>
That code is using the hubdb client
You need to use the search client from the docs above, they are seperate
I imported both of the links above, the database one and the search one
API clients <https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vTuu12oFF4bQY1zVD2-WKFuM2dEDN81-fZRV1tGaCL5Z_OcjC-B6O3mHXR6chaq25BU1D2FuvKIjc49/pub>
Hi All, is there documentation on how we can design our own custom navigation? Posted in general but want to attempt to build an advanced nav with link desc and icon.
there is not but basically you have two options. Use a HS menu module and use JS to inject all of the icons and description text.
OR use HubDB and create a menu using that instead of the menu module
^ What I was going to say. Jon beat me again *shakes fist
I’m fast on the :gun:
